1F96B48E4E0D40F08CE11377F3AF2090.description:
Compare styles of food service, including counter, tray line, seated, banquet, and catering.
• Demonstrating table-setting techniques

378F86EF543143C9BD00150279CAD7B7.description:
Describe basic service skills used in hospitality and tourism industries, including welcoming and
processing guests, overseeing customer comfort, and handling customer complaints.

C84111BB04024AEE9F0F5DB66A018AB3.description:
Describe the Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP) and Material Safety and Data
Sheets (MSDS) standards.
• Identifying foodborne illnesses and hygiene procedures for avoiding each
• Demonstrating proper handling, preparation, and storage of food
• Demonstrating compliance with health codes for food service related to chemical storage,
pest control, and garbage disposal

5BB97FAFF8674A74ACFDD6167333A64D.description:
Define important dietary terms, including bland, low-fat, low-sodium, low-cholesterol, and fatfree
diets.
• Recognizing various food allergies
• Identifying eating disorders
• Classifying major nutrients
• Preparing healthy recipes for special diets

7D2FB045872B47A3B1FD9621D7DECD4A.description:
Explain the importance of developing standardized recipes in a food service operation.
• Interpreting recipe instructions
• Analyzing a recipe for spice and seasoning substitutions and adjustments

64DD554A64C543E680AA3D44623BA517.description: Assess factors that affect food quality, including taste, appearance, color, and texture.

03AA6BF0A52F4C4E9521CB31097D506B.description:
Demonstrate safety when using various cutting tools in a commercial culinary laboratory.
• Comparing knife cuts used in the culinary industry
Examples: julienne, bâtonnet, brunoise, dice, tourne, rondelle, chiffonade
• Identifying sharpening tools, including stone and steel
• Illustrating safe handling and washing techniques for sharpening tools
• Selecting proper cutting tools, including knives, mandolins, choppers, and food processors
for various tasks
• Demonstrating safe knife-sharpening techniques

584C29693E394F42B5A0C7FBA0391030.description:
Apply culinary calculations to recipe conversions, including weight and volume, calories and fat
grams, and food temperature conversions.

E170F5E4616B4F5AA4E2CC98B09DC903.description:
Demonstrate operation of food preparation and nonfood commercial equipment, according to
Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards.
• Classifying small and large food preparation equipment
• Describing the calibration of food preparation equipment
• Measuring portions with ladles, cups, spoons, and scales
• Analyzing warranties and service agreements for proper maintenance of food preparation
equipment
• Identifying proper handling, storage, and cleaning of food preparation equipment

8C4C309509264653ADDF7E055070021F.description:
Organize the back-of-the-house and front-of the-house of a culinary laboratory for function,
efficiency, time management, and cost.

285D8F09D49B4780A7FE30F6AC42DA28.description:
Identify the role of various departments within a lodging facility.
Examples: housekeeping, maintenance, landscaping

8D1F43EBA3654F8EA3E652A4A66B4630.description: Identify criteria used for classifying hotel properties.

87E13195282D44119C07E5034F5651DF.description: Determine stages in the guest cycle, including pre-arrival, arrival, occupancy, and departure.

BB082227F47D4C539FC691F535B55F03.description:
Describe strategies involved in planning various events, including golf tournaments, weddings,
and anniversary celebrations.

AAB5D37BE391459480658D59EB6A447D.description:
Compare types of recreation, travel, and tourism activities.
• Examples: amusement parks, museums, sporting events, destination vacations, cruises, spas,
resorts, tours, attractions, theaters, reunions

19A59D5EADBA49B58E1CF05554BEBA23.description:
Determine career pathways, entrepreneurial opportunities, and required credentials related to
hospitality and tourism.

3A060D5552FE4C0F8DC664E600B7F3DC.description: Determine technology tools that impact hospitality and tourism industries.

6283BE85B71441268C6A42A56F767A84.description:
Explain the impact of goal setting, teamwork, and technical skills on careers in hospitality and
tourism industries.
• Recognizing the importance of FCCLA programs to hospitality and tourism industries

AB9E0399A0434737A21315FAD076FC2B.description:
Apply mathematical, reading, writing, terminology, critical-thinking, decision-making,
communication, financial literacy, and problem-solving skills to hospitality and tourism
industries.

1FD915880B0D49ED9F459EED00BAE21D.description:
Trace the history of hospitality and tourism industries, including culinary and food services,
lodging, travel and tourism, and legal and ethical issues.
